availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Lexington, Louisville, Paducah, and Camp Nelson, Kentucky. Headquarters in Lexington. Mustered in from January 3, 1865, to June 23, 1865. Mustered out on April 27, 1866. Commander(s): Colonel Charles G. Bartlett.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 92-101.
William A. Dobak, Freedom by the Sword: the U. S. Colored Troops, 1862-1867, (Washington, D. C.: Center of Military History, United States Army, 2011), 475.
KYR-0001-004-1795.
